ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of recurrent infections, large right TM perforation, and left mass-dominated middle ear system.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Recurrent episodic vertigo triggered by position changes; history of successful treatment with Epley maneuvers.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral sloping hearing loss; bone conduction thresholds indicate sensorineural component in left and underlying mixed loss in right.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Visual inspection of the ear canal and tympanic membrane.
Assessment of middle ear status and ear canal volume.
Differentiation of middle ear pathology due to negative pressure observed in the left ear.
Assessment of hearing thresholds and configuration.
Assessment of speech reception and recognition abilities.
Evaluation of retrocochlear and middle ear function.
Post-operative assessment of tympanic membrane healing and mobility.
Verification of hearing aid output to prescribed targets.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Baseline evaluation revealed a large right tympanic membrane perforation causing mixed hearing loss, and a left sensorineural hearing loss with negative middle ear pressure. A 678-Hz tympanogram on the left indicated a mass-dominated system consistent with chronic otitis media. The patient reported severe subjective handicap.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Right: Large central perforation without drainage. Left: Intact and normal.

tests.name: Tympanometry (226 Hz)
tests.result_summary: Right: Type B with large volume (4.5 mL). Left: Normal volume/compliance but negative pressure (-155 daPa).

tests.name: Tympanometry (678 Hz)
tests.result_summary: Left: Mass-dominated system consistent with chronic otitis media.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Mixed hearing loss with 15-30 dB air-bone gaps. Left: Moderate-severe SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs consistent with PTAs. WRS: Right 60%, Left 80%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right: Not measurable. Left: Absent ipsi/contra.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Post-operative assessment following right tympanoplasty showed closure of the perforation and resolution of air-bone gaps, resulting in symmetric sensorineural hearing loss. Hearing aids were fitted and verified to targets.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right air-bone gaps resolved. Symmetric slight sloping to severe SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: WRS improved to 72% in both ears.

tests.name: Tympanometry (226 Hz)
tests.result_summary: Right: Hypocompliant (0.2 mL) with normal volume (perf closed). Left: Normal.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent in both ears for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Verification (Real-Ear)
tests.result_summary: Output matched NAL-NL2 targets within 5 dB across frequencies.

escalation.rationale_short: Surgical management of perforation and medical clearance for amplification.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and hearing aid benefit.
